rComments: He doesn't explain things too clearly. If he lectured about an experiment, doesn't go too much into depth. He's a fair grader though and DOES give a decent amount of extra credit which helped

5 HW assignments. 2 midterms. 1 final. it should not be too hard if you attend class and read the readings. i would highly recommend this course as your cognitive course if you are majoring in psych and are a bit afraid of the cog. section, I was and don't think it was too tough.

Davidenko is an excellent professor, he's informative, helpful, explains the material well, posts his lectures online, but you still should attend class, he gives interesting demonstrations during lectures, gives thorough studyguides for exams, if you study then his short-response exams are doable, textbook is useful, and he offers extra credit.

He's alright. Not great, not bad, just meh. He gives lots of extra credit and it's easy to catch up, but he doesn't really explain demos or his expectations of the class very well. He also speaks in a bit of a monotonic voice. It's only when he had a passion for the specific topic he taught where the lecture was more interesting to follow.

Interesting topic. Great teaching skills. Short answer midterms and final. Easy to bring your grade up if you realize late you have to read the book to pass the tests. The book is comprehensible with good images read it before lecture for an easy A. Don't get the 6th version of the text. Later versions have figures in color that are useful.
